paragraphs.body: Haru was a skilled teenage ${link_0} whose ${link_1} ${link_2} was temporarily occupied by the ${link_3} during the ${link_4}. paragraphs.text: Haru was a skilled teenage earthbender whose Earth Kingdom village was temporarily occupied by the Fire Nation during the Hundred Year War. After breaking his father, Tyro, and several others out of Fire Nation prison, with the aid of Team Avatar, he joined forces with Hakoda and took part in the invasion of the Fire Nation. Following their defeat, he escaped with the rest of the young people of the invasion force atop Appa, taking refuge at the Western Air Temple. When Azula attacked the temple, Haru managed to escape with Hakoda and friends, and was later present for the coronation of Fire Lord Zuko.

paragraphs.body: Although Haru was a talented ${link_0}, the development of his skills was halted due to the suppressive, ${link_1}-controlled environment in which he lived.
paragraphs.text: Although Haru was a talented earthbender, the development of his skills was halted due to the suppressive, Fire Nation-controlled environment in which he lived.

paragraphs.body: Haru was born to ${link_0} and ${link_1} and was taught earthbending by his father.
paragraphs.text: Haru was born to Tyro and his wife and was taught earthbending by his father.

paragraphs.body: When the Fire Nation invaded their village in 94 AG, Haru witnessed his father and the other earthbenders fight back, despite being outnumbered, and ultimately led away, leaving him alone with his mother. To ensure his safety, Haru was forbidden from earthbending by his mother, although he continued to practice in secret, as a way to feel close to his father.
paragraphs.text: When the Fire Nation invaded their village in 94 AG, Haru witnessed his father and the other earthbenders fight back, despite being outnumbered, and ultimately led away, leaving him alone with his mother. To ensure his safety, Haru was forbidden from earthbending by his mother, although he continued to practice in secret, as a way to feel close to his father.

paragraphs.body: During the late fall of 99 AG, as Haru was practicing alone, ${link_0} ${link_1} and his friends stumbled upon him. Later, when Haru and ${link_2} struck up a kinship over shared experiences, they came upon a villager trapped under a rock slide. Haru aided him through earthbending, but the old man betrayed him to the Fire Nation soldiers and the young earthbender was taken into custody.
paragraphs.text: During the late fall of 99 AG, as Haru was practicing alone, Avatar Aang and his friends stumbled upon him. Later, when Haru and Katara struck up a kinship over shared experiences, they came upon a villager trapped under a rock slide. Haru aided him through earthbending, but the old man betrayed him to the Fire Nation soldiers and the young earthbender was taken into custody.

paragraphs.body: Aang and ${link_0} helped engineer Katara's false arrest for earthbending so she would be taken to the shipyard. There, she and Haru helped stir up a mass prison rebellion and escape. Reunited with his father and reinforced by fellow earthbenders, Haru had a chance to drive the Fire Nation away from his home.
paragraphs.text: Aang and Sokka helped engineer Katara's false arrest for earthbending so she would be taken to the shipyard. There, she and Haru helped stir up a mass prison rebellion and escape. Reunited with his father and reinforced by fellow earthbenders, Haru had a chance to drive the Fire Nation away from his home.

paragraphs.body: Following their escape, Haru and his father helped to liberate their village from Fire Nation control as a part of the ${link_0}.
paragraphs.text: Following their escape, Haru and his father helped to liberate their village from Fire Nation control as a part of the Earth Kingdom rebellions.

paragraphs.body: Haru and ${link_0} took an active role in the ${link_1}.
paragraphs.text: Haru and Tyro took an active role in the invasion of the Fire Nation.

paragraphs.body: Haru, now sporting a mustache and a goatee, was one of many familiar but noticeably distinct faces recruited by Sokka to help in the invasion of the Fire Nation on the ${link_0}. Haru and his father were part of the ground forces attacking the Fire Nation capital. When the submarines were destroyed, the warriors decided to surrender; Haru promised Tyro that they would return to rescue them. The young people, namely Aang, Katara, Sokka, ${link_1}, ${link_2}, ${link_3}, and Haru, escaped on ${link_4} and traveled to the Western Air Temple.
paragraphs.text: Haru, now sporting a mustache and a goatee, was one of many familiar but noticeably distinct faces recruited by Sokka to help in the invasion of the Fire Nation on the Day of Black Sun. Haru and his father were part of the ground forces attacking the Fire Nation capital. When the submarines were destroyed, the warriors decided to surrender; Haru promised Tyro that they would return to rescue them. The young people, namely Aang, Katara, Sokka, Toph, Teo, The Duke, and Haru, escaped on Appa and traveled to the Western Air Temple.

paragraphs.body: Haru befriended both Teo and The Duke after the invasion, and upon arrival at the Western Air Temple, he and his two friends began to explore the sanctuary. They found it to be the perfect place to hang out and for Haru to practice earthbending. While staying at the temple, Haru took part in numerous activities with the team, including spectating at a "swordbending" match, practicing his bending, and joining Sokka's "Bendless Boomerang Club" after he decided to open it up to the whole team.
paragraphs.text: Haru befriended both Teo and The Duke after the invasion, and upon arrival at the Western Air Temple, he and his two friends began to explore the sanctuary. They found it to be the perfect place to hang out and for Haru to practice earthbending. While staying at the temple, Haru took part in numerous activities with the team, including spectating at a "swordbending" match, practicing his bending, and joining Sokka's "Bendless Boomerang Club" after he decided to open it up to the whole team.

paragraphs.body: Haru stuck with Aang's group until Azula and an ${link_0} attacked the temple. He fled along with Hakoda and his friends while Aang's group flew off on Appa. He later reunited with them during Zuko's coronation after the Hundred Year War ended, finally together with his father once again.
paragraphs.text: Haru stuck with Aang's group until Azula and an air fleet attacked the temple. He fled along with Hakoda and his friends while Aang's group flew off on Appa. He later reunited with them during Zuko's coronation after the Hundred Year War ended, finally together with his father once again.

paragraphs.body: Haru exerted a cool control over the ${link_0} when he used his ${link_1} abilities.
paragraphs.text: Haru exerted a cool control over the earth when he used his bending abilities.

paragraphs.body: Haru was a skilled earthbender; even with minimal training, he was able to manipulate boulders and prevent debris from crushing a man. He preferred earthbending with his hands unlike most earthbenders, who preferred to earthbend with their feet. He and four other earthbenders, including Tyro, created a shield strong enough to withstand a combined blast from several firebenders. Together with his father, Haru was able to compress a large amount of coal into a single projectile, a difficult feat to accomplish.
paragraphs.text: Haru was a skilled earthbender; even with minimal training, he was able to manipulate boulders and prevent debris from crushing a man. He preferred earthbending with his hands unlike most earthbenders, who preferred to earthbend with their feet. He and four other earthbenders, including Tyro, created a shield strong enough to withstand a combined blast from several firebenders. Together with his father, Haru was able to compress a large amount of coal into a single projectile, a difficult feat to accomplish.
